Published January 19th 2024 


20 Social Media Holidays to Celebrate This February


Gear up for success in 2024 with these inspiring February social media holidays. 







 






 






 






 






 




















As we transition into the second month of the year, February underlines the need to spread love and warmth in the context of romance, friendships, and beyond. This month has it all, from pizza-related celebrations to getting hyped about the Super Bowl. Your social media managers will be thanking us for these thought starters.  Black History Month #BlackHistoryMonthFebruary 2. World Wetlands Day #WorldWetlandsDayFebruary 4. World Cancer Day #WorldCancerDayFebruary 6. Safer Internet Day #SaferInternetDayFebruary 7. National Send a Card to a Friend Day #SendACardToAFriendDayFebruary 9. National Pizza Day #NationalPizzaDayFebruary 10. Chinese New Year #LunarNewYear #ChineseNewYearFebruary 11. Inventors Day #InventorsDayFebruary 11. International Day of Women and Girls in Science #WomenInScienceFebruary 11. Super Bowl LVI #SBLV #SuperBowlSunday #SuperBowlFebruary 13. World Radio Day #WorldRadioDayFebruary 13. Galentine’s Day #Galentines February 14. Valentine's Day #ValentinesDayFebruary 17. Random Acts of Kindness Day #RandomActsOfKindnessDayFebruary 18. World Whale Day #WorldWhaleDayFebruary 19. Presidents' Day #PresidentsDayFebruary 20. Love Your Pet Day #LoveYourPetDayFebruary 21. International Mother Language Day #IMLDFebruary 22. World Thinking Day #WorldThinkingDay February 23. National Skip the Straw Day #SkiptheStrawDay All of these unofficial holidays present a unique opportunity for your brand’s social media content output to capture the attention and hearts of your target audience. You never know who’s a stickler for listening to the radio. 










Black History Month #BlackHistoryMonthFirst observed in 1970, Black History Month is beloved across the world and is centered on celebrating Black culture and the successes and struggles of Black individuals throughout history. 









  @byrdie #BlackOwned makeup brands to support this #blackhistorymonth and beyond💄 #blacktiktok #makeup #beautytok ♬ So I Want You ft Kylie M Bailey - Bobcat Goldwav    









February 2. World Wetlands Day #WorldWetlandsDayWorldWetlands Day is about raising public awareness of the importance of conserving wetlands and the vital role they play for humans and the planet. Fun fact: More than a third of endangered species rely directly or indirectly on wetlands for survival. 









        View this post on Instagram            A post shared by Kiawah Island Golf Resort (@kiawahresort)  













You might like

The Marketer of 2024 Report
What skills and tools do marketers need to make it big in 2024?






Take me there





















February 4. World Cancer Day #WorldCancerDayIt’s all about encouraging the prevention, detection, and treatment of this disease; one of the world’s most feared. This global initiative is led by the Union for International Cancer Control (UICC) and has been commemorated annually on this day since the year 2000. 









        View this post on Instagram            A post shared by FUJIFILM EMEA (@fujifilmemea)  









February 6. Safer Internet Day #SaferInternetDayAs the internet becomes increasingly prominent in our daily lives, so does the need for us to make it a safe place to visit and be a part of for everyone, especially children and young people. Film recommendation: Cyber Bully (2011) (Dir. Charles Binamé) 









Safer Internet Day is only three weeks away. Join us on the 6th of February to spread awareness about online safety and inspire change to build safer and more inclusive online experiences.#SaferInternetDay pic.twitter.com/QuWZvYqKyq— VfyMy (@VfyMy) January 16, 2024  









February 7. National Send a Card to a Friend Day #SendACardToAFriendDayText messages, voice notes, and videos can do the same job, leaving you feeling all warm and fuzzy at the thoughtfulness of your friend’s gesture. But we’re bringing snail mail and handwritten notes back. Think carefully about the kind of card you’d like to buy, what color pen you’d like to use, and maybe polish up your handwriting. I recently got my friend a “Hi Barbie” themed card for her birthday. She loved it. 









        View this post on Instagram            A post shared by Hello Kitty (@hellokitty)  









February 9. National Pizza Day #NationalPizzaDayWe have a lot to thank Italy for. Especially food-wise. On this day, it doesn’t matter if you’re team BBQ flavored pizza, team pineapples on pizza, thick crust, or thin… All that matters is the beauty of the bread and its customizable toppings. It should also be a pretty easy sell to your boss for a pizza party (you’re welcome). 









  @comfeeuk Bon apple tea 🍕🤌 #mugpizza #microwaverecipe #pizzarecipe #comfee #Nationalpizzaday #Pizza #Pizzaday ♬ original sound - ComfeeUK    









February 10. Chinese New Year #LunarNewYear #ChineseNewYearUsher in the year of the Wood Dragon, beginning on February 10, 2024, and concluding on January 28, 2025. The Dragon, which like all other elemental Dragons, comes once every 60 years, is associated with qualities like power, vigor, fiery energy, and exciting possibilities.  









 









February 11. Inventors Day #InventorsDayCuriosity, innovation, brilliance. These words might come to mind when you think about inventors and the important work they do. From Da Vinci to Stephanie Kwolek and Henry Ford, we’re glad to have a day dedicated to honoring these great minds and the transformative contributions they’ve made to society. 









        View this post on Instagram            A post shared by Tetris (@tetris_official)  









February 11. International Day of Women and Girls in Science #WomenInScienceLike we just touched on regarding the previous holiday. Women are incredible at science. Stephanie Kwolek, who passed away 10 years ago, was a Polish-American chemist known for inventing Kevlar in the late 1960s. From law & order and hip hop rivalries to action movies, bullet-proof vests made of this material are always front and center. Side note: Kevlar is also used for more applications, like bicycle tires and racing sails. We’re excited to recognize the achievements of women and girls in science and encourage the next wave of female scientists to leave their mark on the world. 









  @cartoonnetwork She. Does. Science. 👩🏻‍🔬👩🏿‍🔬👩🏼‍🔬👩🏽‍🔬 It's International Day of Women and Girls in Science! #womeninSTEM #fyp #girlsinscience #february11 ♬ She Does Science - Cartoon Network    









February 11. Super Bowl LVI #SBLV #SuperBowlSunday #SuperBowlRihanna made an absolute splash with her Super Bowl halftime performance last year. This time round, we’re excited to see Usher perform. Some viewers tune in for the mini-concert, and others (read: marketers) cannot wait to see the commercials that air (Tubi did not fail to make an impression last year). And, of course, a large demographic tunes in to watch the actual game of American football. Pick your attraction and join in the excitement as we gear up for Super Bowl Sunday 2024. 









        View this post on Instagram            A post shared by FENTY SKIN (@fentyskin)  













You might like

The 2024 Digital Marketing Trends Report
The top 10 need-to-know digital marketing trends of 2024






Take me there





















February 13. World Radio Day #WorldRadioDayA tool for communication, education, entertainment, and amplifying cultural expression, the radio has been a friend to society since the turn of the 20th century. Kids of today might not recognize the significance of radios, but as long as we do, its legacy will carry on. 









        View this post on Instagram            A post shared by House of Marley (@houseofmarley)  









February 13. Galentine’s Day #Galentines Sisterhood is a beautiful thing to behold. Get the girls together for a cute dinner date or outing to celebrate the beauty of your friendship. The more toasts, the better, and the same goes for wine. 









  @mypheme Tag your Galentine’s besties 😍💓💓 #pinkdresses #galentinesdayideas #galentinesday #besties #pinkdressgirl #dresses ♬ feather sped up - focusonspeed    









February 14. Valentine's Day #ValentinesDayThis might be one of February’s most popular unofficial holidays. From primary school crushes to relationships, marriages, and the like, cupid is always in his element on this day. An insight from Brandwatch Consumer Research: Flowers got more social media mentions than chocolates on Valentine’s Day last year (168k vs 165k). 









        View this post on Instagram            A post shared by EndlessGlo Cosmetics, LLC (@endlessglocosmetics)  









February 17. Random Acts of Kindness Day #RandomActsOfKindnessDayCreate a ripple effect of goodwill by taking part in random acts of kindness. It doesn’t matter if they’re friends, family members, colleagues, or complete strangers. Let’s stay on the theme of leading with love as we go through the world in 2024. 









Since it's Random Acts of Kindness Day, we're giving you the chance to #win a case of Boost Energy! ⚡All you need to do to be in with a chance of winning is reply below with your favourite flavour. Closes 23:59, 17/02/21. T&Cs apply. pic.twitter.com/PzEgxbKz34— Boost Drinks (@Boost_Drinks) February 17, 2021  









February 18. World Whale Day #WorldWhaleDayI’m not sure if the same applies to you, but my key association with whales is the Jonah story from Sunday school. Maybe that’s why World Whale Day is celebrated every third Sunday in February. Either way, it’s clear that these titans of the sea have been around for a long time and need our help with protecting their ocean habitat. 









        View this post on Instagram            A post shared by Sand Cloud®️ (@sandcloud)  









February 19. Presidents' Day #PresidentsDayAlthough the day typically honors American presidents George Washington and Abraham Lincoln (both born in February), Presidents' Day has evolved into a day of celebrating the birthdays and lives of all U.S. presidents. 









 









February 20. Love Your Pet Day #LoveYourPetDayWe don’t doubt that you do this every day, but some extra attention for your pet couldn’t hurt. Maybe kick back and watch a movie about their kind of animal with them. Hotel for Dogs, Puss in Boots, Ponyo. Hopefully not Stuart Little? 









        View this post on Instagram            A post shared by MINI India (@miniindia_official)  









February 21. International Mother Language Day #IMLDThere are over 7,100 spoken and signed languages in the world, and even more dialects. Just for some perspective, English, only one of these languages, boasts over 160 dialects. It’s imperative that we all make the effort to keep our languages and dialects alive as the threat of their extinction rises.  









        View this post on Instagram            A post shared by AORUS (@aorus_official)  









February 22. World Thinking Day #WorldThinkingDay Surprisingly niche, World Thinking Day was designed for Girl Guides and Girl Scouts to think about their “sisters” and the impact of Guiding. This day has been commemorated since February 1926 and is celebrated by Scout and Guide organizations in over 150 countries. 









It's #WorldThinkingDay & one thing we can't stop thinking about is #Aphantasia, the inability to visualise in your 'mind's eye'. After listening to @AdamRutherford @FryRsquared talk about Aphantasia, we've been asking everyone!Where do you place on the test?info @_aphantasia pic.twitter.com/VGk5GwhA97— We are Cognitive (@wearecognitive) February 22, 2023  









February 23. National Skip the Straw Day #SkiptheStrawDay February 23 is all about raising awareness about the damaging effects of single-use plastics, like plastic straws. You can observe this day by abandoning straws altogether or opting for reusable options like stainless steel, bamboo, or glass straws. Albeit single-use, paper straws could also be an option because they’re biodegradable. And if you’re feeling really adventurous, consider going for a pasta straw. Yes, they exist. 









  @diversdirect Ditch using plastic straws and use these reusable aluminum ones instead!! #diversdirect #straws #nationalday #aluminumstraw #plasticfree #ecofriendly #straw #beach #environment #plastic ♬ original sound - Divers Direct    









That’s a wrap  Keep the momentum going for your brand and hit all your Q1 goals with our fun-packed social media insights. For more content to help level up your social media and marketing strategy, check out our Social Media Holiday Calendar 2024. 

























Yasmin Pierre

Creative Copywriter Brandwatch
